comments.body: Does this make sense up with first v3 block rather than splitting the logic in half?
Could be either way. Is the logic incorrect here?
Its not incorrect, just harder to read.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +105,109 @@
    if api_version == 'v3':
        response['errors'] = errors_to_return

    json_str = json.dumps(response)

comments.body: I'm pretty sure this test with floats and integers instead of strings was testing to make sure `MANIFEST.json` with those values instead of a string didn't traceback ansible-galaxy like it did before a commit that fixed it. While `ansible-galaxy collection build` would never create a MANIFEST like that I can't guarantee other build tools would be the same.

I'll have to look at the code flow, but when I swapped out `LooseVersion` for `SemanticVersion`, this test began failing.

Maybe I was overzealous in my replacement.

This is due to the change at https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/68258/files#diff-2de3c8cc3e7fae814d02b3058f0c8f9eR365

That ensures that we can compare the version later with a `SemanticVersion`, so it either needs to stay, and cause us to fall back to `*`, or we would need to do what we do with user requirements:

```
SemanticVersion.from_loose_version(LooseVersion(version))
```

`from_loose_version` takes a simplified version, and attempts to convert it to a `SemanticVersion`.
